questions.text: Nerve  supply  to  hypothenar  muscles  is   from  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Ulnar  nerve   

Ref:  BDC  4th  ed.,   Vol-1, p-117  , Clinical   anatomy  Snell,  8th ed .,   p-506

questions.text: Left  ovarian  vein  drain  into  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Left   renal  vein

Ref: Read the text below

Sol 

Left  ovarian  vein  drains  into  Left renal vein  right ovarian  vein  drains to IVC

questions.text: Capacitation takes place  mainly in :-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Fallopian tube

Ref: Read the text below

Sol : Fallopian tube contributes most among female genital tract Although all parts as given in options are involved in this process

questions.text: A young patient with absent thymus and presented with hypoparathyroidism and tetany. Which of the following marked area in the picture is defective in this condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Ref: Read the text below

Sol : 

Given condition is Digeorge syndrome. 
“A” is the marked area for third pharyngeal pouch from where thymus and inf. Parathyroid develop

questions.text: Arterial supply   of  caecum   is  through  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 Ileocolic   artery  

Ref: Read the text below

Sol Ileocolic   artery  supplies terminal part of ileum , part of Ascending colon,Caecum and appendix

questions.text: Stratified  squamous  epithelium  is  seen at  all  the  following  sites   except :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Gallbladder

Ref: Read the text below
Sol 
The gall bladder is lined by a simple columnar epithelium. 
Skin, Vagina & oesophagus are lined by Stratified  squamous  epithelium

questions.text: MC   type  of  cartilage   covering  articular surface  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hyaline Ref: Read the text below Sol Hyaline is MC cartilage covering articular surface

questions.text: Froment  test  is  positive  in  lesion  of  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Ulnar   nerve  

Ref: Read the text below
Sol It is seen in paralysis of Adductor policis supplied by ulnar nerve

questions.text: A middle-aged women complained that her right-hand tremors when she attempts to insert a thread in the eye of sewing needle; and her body sways towards the right side while walking. On physical examination the Physician found that: there is flaccidity of limb muscles on the right side, and when she was asked to touch the tip of her nose with her right index finger, the finger tended to overshoot the target. Which part of the Brain is affected?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cerebellum

Ref: Read the text below

Sol All the given features indicate Cerebellar syndrome

questions.text: A patient recovering from a traumatic injury to the face now finds himself unable to chew his food. On physical examination, his jaw deviates to the right side. The nerve that has been injured in this patient exits the skull through which of the following foramina?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Foramen ovale

Ref: Read the text below

Sol All the given features indicate that Mandibular nerve is involved  hence Foramen ovale is correct

questions.text: Artery lying deep to marked area in the  given Pic is branch of which of the  following artery.?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Maxillary Artery

Ref: Read the text below

Sol Marked area is Pterion and 

Middle Meningeal artery lies deep to pterion 

which is a branch of Maxillary artery

questions.text: Structures passing through the aortic hiatus of diaphragm are all except-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Sympathetic trunk

Ref: Read the text below

Sol

Structures passing through the aortic hiatus of diaphragm are :-

A- Aorta

T – Thoracic duct

A- Azygos vein (Mostly)

Sympathetic trunk passes behind medial arcuate ligament

questions.text: Structures   piercing  clavipectoral  fascia    are all except  :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Basilic vein

Ref: Read the text below

Sol

Basilic vein doesn’t pierce Strucutres piercing are:-

• Cephalic vein

• Acromiothoracic artery

• Lateral Pectoral nerve

• Lymphatics

questions.text: Which  of the following artery  is  present  in  anatomical  snuff  box   :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Radial artery

Ref: Snell’s Clinical Anatomy, 7th ed ., p-533

choices.text: Gluteus  Maximus,  Gluteus   Medius  and   Gluteus  Minimus

questions.text: Positive Trendelenburg  sign    indicates      of  which   group   of   gluteus    muscles    :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Gluterus Medius and Gluteus Minimus

Ref: Read the text below

Sol This is done to check the integrity of Gluterus Medius and Gluteus Minimus and their nerve supply ie superior gluteal nerve.

questions.text: Horse   shoe   kidney  lies   below   the  level  of   :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Inferior mesenteric artery

Ref: Read the text below

Sol It lies at the level of Inferior mesenteric artery because its ascent is blocked by this artery only

questions.text: One person has ingested 3000 mL of water, calculate the amount of water present in Interstitial Fluid after equilibrium-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation- Out of 3000mL of water 1000mL will be in ECF. Out of this, ¾ will be in  Interstitial Fluid so ¾ of 1000mL ie. 750mL.

questions.text: Neuron is least excitable in –
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation- in ARP which is depolarization + 1/3 of repolarization, no matter whatever is the strength of the stimulus a neuron cannot be stimulated again.

questions.text: In a muscle contraction all are true except-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation-  I band reduces in length in muscle contraction.

questions.text: A substance is prepared that specifically and completely inhibits glucose transport in PCT. In healthy volunteer receiving this substance, clearance of glucose will approximate the clearance of which of the following?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation- Glucose is filtered and completely reabsorbed in PCT, if glucose reabsorption is   inhibited then it will be completely filtered just like inulin.

questions.text: A 37-year-old tourist travelling alone in india loses his bag of supplies. After 24 hrs without food and water his urine osmolarity is 900 mOsm/L. Which of the following segments of the nephron is mainly reabsorbing water in this person?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation- in the presence of ADH maximum water is reabsorbed in PCT – 60-70%.

choices.text: Decrease in the amplitude of firing.
Decrease in the number of gap junctions

questions.text: Normal AV delay of 0.1seconds is due to
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation- AV node has less number of gap junctions which is one of the causes of AV nodal delay.

questions.text: When a person moves from a supine position to a standing position, which of the following compensatory changes occurs?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Explanation- change of posture from supine to standing causes venous pooling which decreases CO, blood volume and by the baroreceptor compensatory mechanism will cause an increase in cardiac contractility.

questions.text: Which of the following is an effect of histamine?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation- Histamine causes vasodilation of the arterioles, which increases Pc and capillary filtration. It also causes constriction of the veins, which contributes to the increase in Pc. Acetylcholine (ACh) interacts with muscarinic receptors (although these are not present on vascular smooth muscle).

questions.text: During which phase of the ventricular action potential is the membrane potential closest to the Kequilibrium potential?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation- Phase 4 is the resting membrane potential. Because the conductance to Kis highest, the membrane potential approaches the equilibrium potential for K.

questions.text: During which phase of the ventricular action potential is the conductance to Ca2highest?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation-  Phase 2 is the plateau of the ventricular action potential.During this phase, the conductance to Ca2increases transiently. Ca2that enters the cell during the plateau is the trigger that releases more Ca2from the sarcoplasmic reticulum(SR) for the contraction.

questions.text: The primary motor area for shivering is-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation- posterior hypothalamus is activated in cold environment and prevents fall in body temperature.

questions.text: Most of the following GI secretions have a basal output during the interdigestive period (between meals). However, the sight and smell of a tasty meal stimulates GI secretions. Of the various GI secretions, which is the most stimulated?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation- cephalic phase causes maximum salivary secretion.

questions.text: Below diagram depict which mechanism
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation- diagram shows vasa recta depicting counter current exchanger system.

choices.text: A major determinant is hormone Motilin.
They occur at the interval of 90 to 120 minutes in fasting stage.
Function is to clean the git before next meal.
They don't get abolished after taking food.

questions.text: Which is not true about MMC?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation- MMCs stop on taking meals, occur only in fasting state.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man with a 15-pack-year smoking history is referred for pulmonary function testing. On physical exam, he appears barrel-chested and mildly overweight, but breathes normally. Which of the following tests will most accurately measure his total lung capacity?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation- Body plethysmography is a quick test that measures lung volumes using Boyle's law, which states that at a constant temperature, the volume of gas varies inversely with the pressure applied to it. It can measure the total volume of air in the chest, including gas trapped in bullae. Limitations include equipment complexity and need for the patient to sit in a small enclosed space.

choices.text: Antagonizes the action of prolactin on the breast
Enhances the action of prolactin on the breast
Inhibits prolactin release from the anterior pituitary
Inhibits prolactin release from the hypothalamus

questions.text: A 38-year-old man who has galactorrhea is found to have a prolactinoma. His physician treats him with bromocriptine, which eliminates the galactorrhea. The basis for the therapeutic action of bromocriptine is that it-
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Ans – c – Explanation- Bromocriptine is a dopamine agonist. The secretion of prolactin by the anterior pituitary is tonically inhibited by the secretion of dopamine from the hypothalamus. Thus, a dopamine agonist acts just like dopamine—it inhibits prolactin secretion from the anterior pituitary.

questions.text: What is involved in formation of d-TMP from d-UMP?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

N 5, N 10-methylene tetrahydrofolate

N 5, N 10-methylene tetrahydrofolate is the donor of methyl group in the reaction catalysed by thymidylate synthase. In this process N 5, N 10-methylene tetrahydrofolate is converted to dihydrofolic acid(DHF). DHF reductase then convert DHF to THF

questions.text: Which if the following is an example of reverse transcriptase?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Telomerase	

•	Reverse transcriptase is a RNA dependant DNA polymerase.
•	Telomerase is a reverse transcriptase present in human germline cells (spermatogonia, oogonia) and stem cells (in skin, bone marrow and gut) but is absent from most other somatic cells.

choices.text: Increasing acetyl co A carboxylase activity
Increases the transport of glucose in to the cell

questions.text: Insulin causes lipogenesis by all except ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Inhibits PDH

	Insulin rather increases the activity of PDH. Insulin increases the activity of acetyl Co A carboxylase activity and thus has got stimulatory effect on lipogenesis. 
	Insulin increases the recruitment of GLUT to the surface of various cell and thus increases the uptake of insulin via various cells. Insulin has got inhibitory effect on adenylyl cyclase activity and so causes dephosphorylation.

questions.text: Which of the following activities are low in riboflavin deficiency?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Glutathione reductase

Riboflavin active coenzyme form is FAD

Glutathione reductase NEEDS FAD for its activity

questions.text: What is expected after cholecystectomy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

 Steatorrhea

Steatorrhea is characterized by bulky and frothy stool which is due to excretion of lipid. Due to lack of bile reaching the intestine, bile salt is not available for digestion and absorption of lipid in patient who have undergone cholecystectomy( gall bladder  removal)

questions.text: Cholesterol is synthesized from?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Acetyl Co A

Cholesterol is 27 carbon compound which is derived from acetyl Co A.

questions.text: Menke’s disease is caused by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Copper deficiency

In Menke Disease, Cu is not absorbed from gastrointestinal mucosa due to lack of Cu Binding ATPase 7A protein which is responsible for absorption of copper

questions.text: A person presents with diarrhea, dementia and dermatitis. What is the probable cause?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

pellagra 

Pellagra is due to vitamin B3( Niacin) deficiency and is characterized by diarrhea, dementia and dermatitis

questions.text: The micronutrient that is deficient following post ileal resection is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Vitamin B12 Terminal ileum is required for absorption of Vitamin B12

questions.text: Fat sugar baby is seen in?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Kwashiorkor

questions.text: Which of the following shifts the given curve to left?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Decrease in body temperature

questions.text: Enzymes affected in vitamin B12 deficiency
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


Methionine synthase

There are only two enzymes in human which demand vitamins B12 as cofactor. They are Methyl malonyl CoA mutase/isomerase and Methionine synthase.

choices.text: Increased conversion of fatty acid to acetyl CoA

questions.text: A diabetic patient presented with polyuria, his blood glucose was 240mg/dl.  Which of these is likely to occur in this patient of type 1 DM
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Increased conversion of fatty acid to acetyl CoA

In diabetic patient there is lack of insulin which causes excessive beta oxidation of fatty acid and in uncontrolled case may result in ketogenesis

questions.text: Respiratory quotient of a patient exclusively on carbohydrate diet?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

1

RQ is the ratio of CO2 produced and O2 consumed for the combustion of 1 gram of any food item

questions.text: Fastest way to re-generate ATP during exercise
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

creatine phosphate

At the time of need creatine phosphate provides ATP with the help of enzyme creatine kinase

questions.text: Small or medium sized, sterile vegetations found on both sides of heart valve seen in SLE patients are most likely suggestive of ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

LIBMAN SACKS endocarditis seen in SLE patients on the atrial and ventricular surface

questions.text: A 15 year old male has progressive intra abdominal mass with peripheral lymphadenopathy. He has night sweats, fever, weight lossof 8 kgs over the past few months. Genetic analysis shows t(8;14) what is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Burkitt lymphoma – t(8;14), t(2;8), t(8;22)

questions.text: A 32 year old male presented with thyroid swelling for past 10 months. Histological examination is given in the image below. What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

image shows orphan annie eye nuclei seen in papillary carcinoma thyroid

questions.text: A lady has been diagnosed with breast cancer. Her biopsy report revealing the presence of tumor cells with signet ring appearance, and Indian file pattern is most likely suggestive of –
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

microscopy is classical of invasive lobular carcinoma of breast

questions.text: What is the inheritance pattern shown in the pedigree below?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

pedigree shows mother giving disease to all children and father to none , classical of mitochondrial inheritance

questions.text: Liver biopsy from a patient is as follows. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

In chronic hepatitis B, “ground-glass” hepatocytes—cells with endoplasmic reticulum swollen by HBsAg—is a diagnostic hallmark. Immunostaining can confirm the presence of viral antigen. Chronic hepatitis C quite commonly shows lymphoid aggregates or fully formed lymphoid follicles.

questions.text: A child with normal parents is diagnosed to have sickle cell anemia, what is the chance of second child having same disease
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Sickle cell anemia is an autosomal recessive disorder, hence the chance of every child having a disease is 1 in 4 (25%)

questions.text: Which of the following describes the correct order of cyclins in cell cycle progression?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: A 80 year old male presented with complaints of fatigue, breathlessness and palpitations. He has no comorbidities and does not smoke or drink. On examination there was pedal edema and vitals were – BP- 100/70, PR-55, SpO2- 94%. An ECG was taken which showed no abnormalities after which he was given oxygen and an ECHO revealed restrictive cardiomyopathy. The physician in doubt of a disease did a cardiac biopsy . Which special stain can be used to confirm the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

amyloidosis is one of the cause of restrictive cardiomyopathy . Congo red stain is done for amyloid  which gives characteristic apple green birefringence when viewed under polarized light

questions.text: A 65 year old man presents with a 4 month history of increasing weight loss, wheezing and shortness of breath. He has smoked two packs of cigarettes a day for 40 years. His past medical history is significant for emphysema and chronic bronchitis. A chest xray shows a 10 cm mass in the left main stem bronchus. A biopsy is obtained shown below in the image. Immunohistochemical studies of this biopsy specimen would most likely show strong expression of which of the following markers?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Image shows keratin pearls , so this is a case of SCC lung . IHC markers of SCC lung = p40 , p63

questions.text:
A 32 year old male complained of fatigue for the past 1 year. Examination revealed massive splenomegaly. His blood workup shows the following findings. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Anemia
TLC- 1,50,000/microL
P/S – showing neutrophils , basophils(4%), myeloblasts, myelocytes, metamyelocytes
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

P/S findings suggestive of CML

questions.text: A child presented with thymic hypoplasia, decreased immunity and hypocalcemia. He also has tetralogy of fallot. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: A 15-year-old presents with joint pain and hematuria after a bout of pharyngitis. Examination shows petechiae in skin, RBC casts in urine and an elevated igA in the blood. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Henoch Schonlein purpura

questions.text: Which among the following is not routinely screened before conducting a blood transfusion?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Most sensitive indicator if iron deficiency anemia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Most sensitive indicator is serum ferritin levels

questions.text: Most characteristic finding of diabetic nephropathy?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: What is mechanism of action of the following method used for hand hygiene?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Image depicts soap which is an anionic surface active agent. It kills microbes by reducing surface tension. Dettol or savlon soap has additional disinfectants conferring dual mechanism of antimicrobial killing.

questions.text: All cause enteric fever except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


Explanation: Salmonella typhimurium is a non-typhoidal Salmonella causing food poisoning. Typhoid is caused by Salmonella enterica subspecies enterica serotypes Typhi, Paratyphi A, B, C.

questions.text: 35 year old TB patient developed hepatotoxicity 3 months after treatment. Sequence of reinitiation of therapy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

R > H > Z > E

Explanation:
•	Antitubercular therapy (ATT) is hepatotoxic.
•	Only Rifampicin (R), Isoniazid (H), pyrazinamide (Z) are hepatotoxic
•	Once hepatotoxity appears, ATT is stopped.
•	ATT is reinitiated one by one in the sequence of Rifampicin (R), Isoniazid (H), pyrazinamide (Z), Ethambutol (E)

questions.text: 22 year old with CSF picture of raised pressure, raised proteins, numerous neutrophils and reduced glucose. Most likely etiology.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: CSF picture depicts acute bacterial or septic meningitis. Since bacteria divide rapidly, there will be raised pressure, raised proteins and reduced glucose. Acute bacterial meningitis will have numerous neutrophils.

questions.text: A 45 year old patient presented with myonecrosis, crepitus and compartment syndrome after a road traffic accident. Likely causative organism.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: Clinical features such as myonecrosis, crepitus and compartment syndrome after a road traffic accident  depict gas gangrene. Gas gangrene is caused by Clostridium perfringens, C. septicum and C. novyi.

questions.text: 30 year old patient with rheumatic valvulitis underwent mitral valve replacement. She developed post operative endocarditis in the replaced valve. Most common cause and diagnostic criteria.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)


Explanation: Most common cause of endocarditis in artificial valve is Staph epidermidis. Most common cause of endocarditis in native valve is Staph aureus.

questions.text: 11 year old schoolboy presented with a centrifugal itchy rash on face on second day of fever. Diagnosis, etiology and treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)
 
Explanation: Centrifugal itchy rash depicts chicken pox or Varicella zoster caused by Varicella zoster virus. It is known as 2nd disease or 2nd day disease, based on appearance of rash on day 2 of fever. It is hyperendemic worldwide and affects all age groups. It is a mild disease in children but may be severe in adults. Chicken pox or Varicella zoster is treated by acyclovir.

questions.text: 32 year female with saddleback fever, rash, and retro-orbital pain after Aedes bite. Diagnosis, treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: Aedes transmits dengue, chikungunya, yellow fever, zika.
(a) Dengue most common – Asymptomatic
(b) Dengue fever (Mild) - Saddleback fever, rash, retro-orbital pain
(c) Dengue hemorrhagic fever – Bleeding manifestations, thrombocytopenia, breakbone fever
(d) Dengue shock syndrome – Hypovoluemic shock
(e) Expanded Dengue Syndrome – Dengue with comorbidities

questions.text: 32 year female detected for a cancer using this instrument. Identify the virus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: Image depicts Cusco’s vaginal speculum used for colposcopy and taking Pap smear. Pap smear is cervical scraping for screening and detection of cervical carcinoma caused by Human Papilloma virus.

questions.text: A viral outbreak occurred in Kerala attributable to fruit bat. Identify
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)


Explanation: Nipah paramyxovirus has caused six outbreaks till date in Kerala. Fruit bats (Pteropus) is associated with Nipah. Nipah causes encephalitis and has high mortality up to 70%. No treatment or vaccine is available.

questions.text: 43 year old pregnant female, mom to 12 kitten, delivered FTND baby with congenital hydrocephalus and headlight in fog chorioretinitis. Diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: Clinical picture depicts congenital toxoplasmosis. Toxoplasma is associated with cat feces. Toxoplamosis causes with congenital hydrocephalus and headlight in fog chorioretinitis.

questions.text: A village head reported the presence of the following insect to district administration. A team of epidemiologists and microbiologists sent for investigation found long hind legs adapted for jumping and no feathers. Diseases transmitted?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: Rat flea (Xenopsylla cheopis) has no wings and long hind legs for jumping. It transmits plague, endemic typhus and Hymenolepis diminuta.

questions.text: Copper penny/sclerotic/medlar bodies or muriform cells are characteristic of
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Copper penny/sclerotic/medlar bodies or muriform cells are characteristic of chromoblastomycosis

questions.text:
Which portion of this molecule binds to cells? Which portion determines the isotype ?
What is the valency in dimeric state?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: Fc portion of antibody molecule binds to cells. Heavy chain determines the isotype. Valency is ability to bind antigen. Valency is 2 in monomeric state and 4 in dimeric state.

choices.text: Clue cell, Bacterial vaginosis, Amsel’s criteria and Nugent’s score
Tzanck cell, Herpes simplex, Lipschultz criteria
Reed Sternberg cell, Hodgkin’s lymphoma, Ann Arbor staging
Granulomatous amoebic meningo-encephalitis, Acanthamoeba, Breteau index

questions.text: A 27 year old female presented with thin homogenous vaginal discharge without fever or pruritus for past 8 months. Vaginal smear revealed the following. Identify the structure, disease and diagnostic criteria.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)


Explanation: Clinical features depict of bacterial vaginosis caused by overgrowth of Gardenerella and Mobiluncus without causing inflammation of vagina. Image depicts clue cell which a vaginal epithelial cell with bacteria attached on surface. Amsel’s criteria and Nugent’s score are used to diagnose bacterial vaginosis

questions.text: 58 year old HIV positive on cotrimoxazole prophylaxis. Protection will be conferred to all except.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)


Explanation: Cotrimoxazole (Trimethoprim + Sulphamethoxazole) is effective for Toxoplasma, Cyclospora, Cystoisospora, Pneumocystis, Nocardia, Listeria, Burkholderia, Acanthamoeba. Metronidazole, tinidazole and secnidazole used for Entamoeba.

questions.text: One pregnant lady on lithium therapy came antenatal visit in OPD. What is the risk the exposed fetus is having by this drug:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Ebstein’s anomaly

questions.text: An elderly patient is diagnosed with Alzeimer’s disease due to his symptoms of dementia. Which drug is given to treat this condition:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Rivastigmine

questions.text: One patient developed rigidity and hyperthermia after giving halothane anaesthetic drug. Which ion is responsible for these symptoms?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Calcium

questions.text: One drug addict person presented with ulceration over skin. This patient also having itching and scratch marks over skin. He is having tachycardia, hypertension and mydriasis. Which substance is causing these symptoms:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Cocaine

questions.text: What is suitable emergency contraception for a 23 year old female within few hours of sexual assault on 13th day of menstrual cycle:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Levonogesterol tablet 1.5 gm

questions.text: Histamine through H1 receptors to cause bronchoconstriction and adrenaline via beta 2 receptors cause bronchodilation to reverse this action. Which type of antasonism is this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Physiological

questions.text: A young male patient is on prolonged oral steroids since more than 10 years. Now having loss of vision in both the eyes. What is the possible reason for this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Posterior subcapsular cataract

questions.text: A person from nonendemic area visited India and was given prophylaxis for malaria. How long the person should continue the drug after leaving from India:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

4 weeks

choices.text: Drug C is less potent and more efficacious than drug A
Drug B is less potent and equally efficacious than drug D
Drug D is more potent and more efficacious than drug B
Drug A is more potent and more efficacious than drug B

questions.text: True statement is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Drug A is more potent and more efficacious than drug B

questions.text: A child was noticed to have spells of fast blinks and staring at something for 30 seconds. Which of the following drugs is for treatment of this conditions:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Valproate

questions.text: A female with whiff test positive with white discharge with clue cell positive. Diagnosis of bacterial vaginosis was made. Which drug was used for the treatment:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Metronidazole

questions.text: Which of the given drugs is used as IV hypnotics:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Propofol, sodium thiopentone, etomidate

questions.text: Drug of choice for Mountain sickness
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Acetazolamide

questions.text: A lady gave birth to child born with NTD. Now she is again pregnant. What should be dose of folic acid recommended to her
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

4 mg

questions.text: Side effect of ACE inhibitors is which of the following
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Dry cough

choices.text: Naproxen (NSAID) is DOC for acute gout
Colchicine is DOC for acute gout
Allopurinol is given in chronic gout
Allopurinol and aspirin contraindicated in acute gout

questions.text: All of the following sentences are true except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Colchicine is DOC for acute gout

questions.text: A chronic alcoholic present with features of global confusion and ophthalmoplegia. Which vitamin deficiency is responsible
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Vitamin B1 – Thiamine is useful to prevent complications associated with alcohol abuse.

questions.text: First permanent teeth to erupt is the
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The first permanent tooth to appear is the first permanent molar.

questions.text: Identify the plant given below
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


Yellow oleander/ Cerebra Thevetia is a cardiac poison.

questions.text: Case of road traffic accident presented with EDH. Where will be impact of collision?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)


Pterion is the confluence of frontal, parietal and temporal bones. It is the weakest part of the skull. Branch of middle meningeal artery passes just below this area.

questions.text: A known alcoholic goes to liquor store & purchases 2 bottles of liquor. He comes out of store and consumes the bottles. After 1 hour he presents with pain abdomen, acute confusion, vision loss and unsteady gait. Treatment for this condition is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

It is a case of methanol poisoning for which treatment of choice is Fomepizole. Since it is not an option the treatment would be Ethyl alcohol.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an indication of auditory brainstem implant
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mondini’s dysplasia of cochlea
Ref: Read the text below    
Sol:
•	Brain stem implant is placed on lateral recess of 4th ventricle near cochlear nucleus for stimulation.

choices.text: Examination of pharynx shows a midline bulge on posterior pharyngeal wall
Mostly presents as a paediatric airway emergency
X ray soft tissue neck lateral view shows widening of prevertebral shadow
Retropharyngeal space extends from skull base to bifurcation of trachea

questions.text: All of the following are true about acute retropharyngeal abscess except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Examination of pharynx shows a midline bulge on posterior pharyngeal wall
Ref: Read the text below
Sol:
Retropharyngeal Space - Between the buccopharyngeal fascia covering the pharyngeal constrictor  & the prevertebral fascia
	* Extends from base of skull to bifurcation of trachea
	* Divided by a fibrous raphe into 2 (spaces of Gilette)
	* Abscess causes U/L bulge on post pharyngeal wall
Acute retropharyngeal abscess - Commonly seen in children < 3yrs
	* Results of suppuration of retropharyngeal LN
	* In adults - from penetrating injury of post. pharyngeal wall
C/F :	* Dysphagia & difficulty in breathing (prominent symp)
	* Stridor & croupy cough
	* Torticollis
	* Bulge in post. Pharyngeal wall (usually seen on one side of midline)
	Xray STN lat. view - widening of prevertebral shadow
T/t - I & D without GA, antibiotics

questions.text: A 30- year old woman with family history of hearing loss from her mother’s side developed hearing problem during pregnancy. Hearing loss is bilateral, slowly progressive, Study on the given audiogram and comment on diagnosis ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Otosclerosis

Ref: Read the text below    
Sol:
•	In otosclerosis—50% cases have positive family history.
•	Females are affected more than males.
•	Bilateral conductive deafness seen in otosclerosis is not irreversible as it can be successfully treated by stapedectomy /Stapedotomy.
•	Sensorineural hearing loss occurs when later in the course of time osteosclerotic focus reaches the cochlear endosteum but actually most common hearing loss seen is conductive type.
•	Carharts notch is seen in bone conduction curve at 2000 Hz.

questions.text: A case of carcinoma larynx with the involvement of Left vocal cord, left aryepiglottic fold, left ventricular band and invading into paraglottic space. Which of the following statements is true for the managements of this case?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Total Laryngectomy and radiotherapy
Ref: Read the text below
Sol:
•	This is the stage T3 of cancer larynx as there is involvement of paraglottic space. 
•	Therefore total laryngectomy and radiotherapy is required in this case.

choices.text: Excessive crust formation and roomy nasal cavities
Modified young’s operation is the total closure of nostrils

questions.text: All of the following are features of atrophic rhinitis except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)


Modified young’s operation is the total closure of nostrils
Ref: Read the text below
Sol:
The surgical management of atrophic rhinitis includes ---
A.Young's operation:- -	            Complete Closure of one nostril 
B. Modified Young's operation:- -	partial closure of both nostrils leaving behind a 3m hole
C. Lautenslager's operation:- 		Surgical procedures aimed at medializing the lateral nasal wall by injecting Substance like Paraffin , teflon, polythene , cartilage

questions.text: The radiological presence of which paranasal sinus appears last in human life
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Frontal sinus
Ref: Read the text below
Sol:
•	Maxillary sinus -- Present at birth and radiologically visualized by 4-5 months of age
•	Frontal sinus develops in the fourth year of life.  It is radiographically visible in children more than 6 year of age
•	Ethmoid sinus is present at birth. Radiologically appreciable by 1 year of age.
•	Sphenoid sinus is radiologically appreciable by 4 years of age
•	Water’s view is occipitomental view. It shows all sinuses except ethmoid.
•	Calwell’s view is occipito frontal view and is best for ethmoid and frontal view.

questions.text:
A 75 yrs old patient of T4NoMo carcinoma larynx has undergone total laryngectomy. He has permanent tracheostomy following this surgery. He is using the device given in picture for vocal rehabilitation?                                

                               


What is the name of this device?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)


Electrolarynx device.
Ref: Read the text below.
Sol:- Electrolarynx or artificial larynx is a hand held device.                                                 

•    Blom singer prosthesis is a tracheoesophageal puncture device.
•    It is a one way valve surgically placed between trachea and esophagus.
•    It is used for vocal rehabilitation after laryngectomy.
•    It  sends air from trachea to esophagus which is used to produce voice.
•    But it does not let the food particles to go from esophagus to trachea so aspiration is not significant.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about the anatomy of larynx
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Sensory supply of infraglottic larynx is by internal laryngeal nerve
Ref– Read the text below 
Sol:  
•	The sensory supply of larynx till vocal cords is by internal branch of superior laryngeal nerve. 
•	Below the vocal cords, the sensory supply is by recurrent laryngeal nerve

questions.text: Through which of the following cranial nerves is cough reflex on cleaning the ear mediated?
questions.solution:

10th nerve

Sol:

questions.text: A 58 yrs old patient presents with fever, sore throat and difficulty to swallow. His radiograph is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Acute Epiglottitis
Ref– Read the text below
Sol:   
•	In acute epiglottitis, the epiglottis is swaollen and this finding on lateral soft tissue X Ray is known as “thumb sign”.
•	Absence of a deep well defined vallecula, known as vallecula sign is also seen in acute epiglottitis.

questions.text: Perilymph is the fluid between the membranous and bony labyrinth. Perilymph is rich in which ion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)
Sodium
Ref– Read the text below
Sol:   
The two main fluids in inner ear are perilymph and endolymph
PERILYMPH
	.Resembles ECF, rich in sodium ions
.Fills the space between bony and memnranous labyrinth
. Communicates with CSF (subarachnoid space) through aqueduct of cochlea, Which opens into scala tympani near the round window
. Is an ultrafiltrate of blood serum
ENDOLYMPH
•	Resembles ICF, rich in potassium ions
•	Secreted by secretory cells of stria vascularis of cochlea and by the dark cells in utricle and near the ampulla of semicircular canal.

questions.text: A 37-year-old post covid patient presents with painful swelling in the left retro-orbital region and nose for five days. The patient had a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus with uncontrolled blood glucose for two years as well as a family history of diabetes mellitus.A nasal swab and a large necrotic mass in the nasal cavity as shown in the image were microbiologically assessed by fungal smears and cultures.Choose the most appropriate drug of choice
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Amphotericin B

Ref: Read the text below Sol:

Primary Treatment of Mucormycosis (Mucormycosis)

questions.text: A patient  presents in  emergency with high grade fever, seizure and altered sensorium. On history he was known case of CSOM and was under treatment. and was undergoing CSOM treatment. Immediate CT was done. Choose the most appropriate Diagnosis ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Temporal lobe abscess

Ref: Read the text below
Sol:

Otogenic Brain Abscess:
    Temporal lobe abscess: Cerebellar abscess = 2:1.
    Organisms: Commonest: Anaerobic streptococci.
    Nominal Aphasia, homonymous hemianopia, focal epilepsy.

Mastoidectomy:
Canal wall down (CWD) procedures:
•    Modified radical mastoidectomy
•    Radical mastoidectomy
•    Atticotomy
Canal wall up (CWU) procedures:
•    Cortical    mastoidectomy    (Schwartz operation)
Combined approach tympanoplasty

choices.text: Technetium scan is more useful in the prognostic evaluation of this entity
ESR can be used to monitor the progression of disease
Facial nerve is the most commonly involved nerve

questions.text: All are true about malignant otitis externa except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Technetium scan is more useful in the prognostic evaluation of this entity
Ref– Read the text below 
Sol:  
Locally destructive infection of bony EAC which is part of skull base. The infection spreds to skull base therefore this disease is actually skull base osteomyelitis
caused by  pseudomonas
predisposing factors
	Diabetes 
	Elderly
	Immunosuppressed
local destruction can involve skull base, mastoid, petrous apex, etc,
There are granulations is the external auditory canal which leads to blood stained ear discharge. Patient has severe ear ache.
 Cranial nerve palsies (7, 9-12) can be there – facial nerve is the most commonly involved nerve
Treatment:
o	antibiotics (3rd Generation cephalosporins, high dose ciprofloxacin)
o	debridment if no response to medical treatment
o	management of underlying cause
Radionucleide gallium ( good for prognostic evaluation) and technetium scan ( good for diagnosis) are helpful in the management. Also ESR is a good tool to monitor disease activity.
